meanings.definition: To cause (someone) to feel upset or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions frust her classmates during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site can frust the residents in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the knots in her necklace only seemed to frust her more.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam seemed to frust the drivers beyond measure.
meanings.sent5: The repeated errors in the report frust the boss to the point of frustration.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disappointment or annoyance caused by the failure of expectations or hopes.
meanings.sent1: After the team lost the game, a sense of frust lingered among the fans.
meanings.sent2: The frust of not finding her keys when she was already late was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The frust of the broken elevator led to everyone taking the stairs.
meanings.sent4: The frust of waiting in line for hours made the amusement park visit less enjoyable.
meanings.sent5: The frust of the rainy weather ruining the picnic plans was palpable.
